DOC.brief_summary: Sodium-dependent glucose transporter ( SGLTs ) family glucose transporter express apical surface epithelial cell intestine kidney . Their function actively transport glucose across epithelia blood . Members SGLT-family transporter include SGLT1 , SGLT2 , SGLT3 SGLT4 , SGLT2 primary glucose transporter kidney . SGLT2 inhibitors new class anti-diabetic drug approve treatment type 2 diabetes ( T2DM ) . These drug inhibit SGLT2-mediated reabsorption glucose renal proximal tubule -- thereby increase urinary glucose excretion decrease plasma glucose level . We hypothesize pharmacodynamic response SGLT2 inhibitor ( specifically canagliflozin ) varies among individual , proportion inter-individual variation explain genetic variation . To explore hypothesis , conduct pilot study healthy , non-diabetic subject glucose relate metabolite urine plasma measure administration single dose canagliflozin . This allow u characterize inter-individual variation pharmacodynamic response canagliflozin well determine change glucose relate metabolite level associate variant candidate gene ( SLC5A4 , SLC5A9 , SLC2A9 ) .
